Joab killed Abner[who was the son of Ner].  Abner was the leader of Israel's army.  Joab also killed Amasa[who was the son of Jether].  Amasa was the leader of Judah's army.  Abner and Amasa were better than Joab.  Abner and Amasa were more honest than Joab.

Version 1:
[After Shimei talked to Solomon] Shimei stayed in Jerusalem for three years.  Then two slaves of Shimei run-away from Shimei.  The slaves ran to Achish[who was the king of Gath].  The king was the son of Maakah.  People told Shimei [Shimei's slaves were in Gath].

Verse: [When Shimei heard [that Shimei's slaves were in Gath]], Shimei put a saddle on Shimei's donkey.  Then Shimei went to Achish[who was at Gath] [in-order-to look for Shimei's slaves].  Shimei found Shimei's slaves.  And Shimei brought Shimei's slaves back to Jerusalem from Gath.

Verse: Ben-Geber governed the people[who lived in Ramoth[that was in Gilead]].  This region included the villages of Jair[who was the son of Manasseh]. People used bronze poles to lock those gates.

Verse: The rooms[that were on the first floor] were 230 centimeters wide. The rooms[that were on the second floor] were 275 centimeters wide. And the rooms[that were on the third floor] were 320 centimeters wide.  The walls of the high rooms were thinner than the walls of the low rooms.  So a flat ledge was at the top of each low wall.  The flat ledge hold-up the beams[that hold-up the floor].  So the beams were not in the temple walls.  (footnote) in Hebrew, these distances are 5 cubits wide, 6 cubits wide, and 7 cubits wide.

Verse: Your(Yahweh's) people might do things[that you(Yahweh) hate].  And there is not a person[who does not do some thing[that you(Yahweh) hate]].  Then you(Yahweh) might become angry with your(Yahweh's) people.  And you(Yahweh) might allow [the enemies of your(Yahweh's) people to defeat your(Yahweh's) people].  And those enemies might take your(Yahweh's) people to the land of those enemies.  And those enemies might make [your(Yahweh's) people be prisoners of those enemies].  That land might be close. Or that land might be far.  The place[where that land is] is not important.

Verse: But your(Yahweh's) people might change the actions of your(Yahweh's) people [while your(Yahweh's) people are prisoners in the land of the enemies of your(Yahweh's) people].  And your(Yahweh's) people might change the thoughts of your(Yahweh's) people and the actions of your(Yahweh's) people [so-that those thoughts and actions please God].  And your(Yahweh's) people might beg [you(Yahweh) to help your(Yahweh's) people in the land of the enemies of your(Yahweh's) people].  Your(Yahweh's) people might say, ["We(people) have done things[that you(Yahweh) hate]].  We(people) have done things[that are bad].  We(people) have done evil things."

Verse: At that time Solomon celebrated the Feast-of-Booths. All Israel's people[who had gathered] were with Solomon.  And those people were an extremely big crowd.  People came from places[that were far-away-from Jerusalem].  People came from Lebo-Hamath.  And people came from the Wadi-of-Egypt.  All these people celebrated in-front-of Yahweh[who is our(Israel's) God] for seven days. And then those people continued celebrating the feast for seven more days.  The total number of days[that the people celebrated] was 14.

Verse: The king made beams with the wood-almug.  And the king used those beams [in-order-to make the temple of Yahweh and the royal house of the king].  And those structures were strong because of those beams.  The king also made harps and lyres for people[who played music] with the wood-almug.  (alt) The king also made instruments[that had strings] for people[who played music] with the wood-almug.  The amount of wood-almug[that Hiram's ships brought to Judah] is more-than any amount of wood-almug[that people have brought to Judah since that time].  And people have not seen that amount of wood-almug in Judah since that time.

Verse: Jeroboam made a new big meal[so-that people could celebrate that big meal every year]. The big meal was on the 15th day of the 8th month. Jeroboam wanted [the big meal to be like the Feast-of-Booths[that people celebrated in Judah]]. Jeroboam built a structure[where people gave gifts to the gods] at Bethel. Jeroboam offered sacrifices on the structure[where people gave gifts to the gods]. Jeroboam sacrificed offerings to the calves[that Jeroboam had made]. Jeroboam also put priests in Bethel. And Jeroboam put priests at the high places[that Jeroboam had made].

Jeroboam pointed at the man-of-God with Jeroboam's hand. And Jeroboam said, ["You(people) (imp) hold that man!"] But [after Jeroboam said this thing,] Jeroboam's arm became hard. Jeroboam was not able [to return Jeroboam's arm to Jeroboam's side].

Then those prophets danced around the altar [that those prophets had made].

Verse: So Elisha left Elijah. Elisha took Elisha's set of cows. And Elisha killed those cows. Elisha burned the tool [that Elisha attached to the cows [so-that those cows could dig the field]] [in-order-to make a fire]. Elisha boiled the meat. And Elisha gave the meat to the people. And the people ate the meat. Then Elisha followed Elijah. And Elisha became Elijah's servant.

Verse: My(Hiram's) servants will bring the very big pieces of wood from Lebanon to the sea-Mediterranean. At that place my(Hiram's) servants will tie the very big pieces of wood to each-other(pieces) [in-order-to make boats]. Then my(Hiram's) servants will take the boats south along the shore to a place [that you(Solomon) choose]. Then my(Hiram's) servants will separate the very big pieces of wood from each-other(pieces). And your(Solomon's) servants will take the very big pieces of wood from that place. Then you(Solomon) will pay me(Hiram) [by you(Solomon) giving enough food to me(Hiram) [so-that all the people [who live in my(Hiram's) house] will be able [to eat]]]."
